p: As shown in Table S1, there were no cytotoxic effects on cell lines evaluated in 3-(4,5-dimethylthiazol-2-yl)-2,5-diphenyltetrazolium bromide (MTT) assay (CC 50 > 100 µg/mL). The essential oils investigated did not show antiviral activity against HIV-1 or representatives of Negative-strand RNA viruses (ss-RNA)-viruses (hRSV, VSV) with an EC 50 > 100 µg/mL. In the group of viruses chosen as representative of ss-RNA + viruses (DENV-2, WNV, YFV, CV-B5, poliovirus Sb-1), essential oils were not endowed with great effects, with the only exception being on BVDV. Indeed, Salvia officinalis L. was shown to have moderate antiviral activity on BVDV (EC 50 = 50 ± 3 µg/mL). The essential oil was characterized, and the major constituents are shown in Figure 1.
